conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_C is my first-choice school because I’m strongly interested in your academic environment and would be excited to contribute to the community. I’m applying for your available seat and would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. Given capacities are 1 each, I should apply immediately to my highest-ranked option. School_C’s priority list ranks me (Student_D) 3rd, so acceptance is possible, but competition is likely (Student_C is ranked 1st there and also may apply). Applying now maximizes my chance before seats fill elsewhere.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for ranking School_C as your first choice. We’re happy to offer you admission and would be excited to have you join our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_D is 3rd on School_C's true priority list (behind Student_C and Student_B). In round 1, only Student_D applied. If I accept now, I forgo the chance to match with Student_C or Student_B, who may apply later (though School_C is not their top choice: Student_C ranks School_C 4th; Student_B ranks it 5th). Student_D ranks School_C 1st, so they are likely to commit elsewhere only if rejected. Given the market, Student_C will likely go to School_D or School_A; Student_B likely to School_B/School_D/School_A. Therefore the probability of getting Student_C or Student_B is low, and accepting Student_D secures a solid, high-priority match within quota.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_A is my first choice, and I would enthusiastically enroll if admitted. conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), an early application gives me a chance if higher-priority students go elsewhere. I will express strong commitment to increase willingness to accept if they can.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing that School_A is your first choice. After careful consideration, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is ranked 3rd on School_A’s true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D). Although Student_A is enthusiastic and has School_A as first choice, accepting now would fill the only seat and prevent matching with higher-priority Student_B or Student_D, who may still apply later (neither has contacted School_A yet). Given we have full information, Student_B ranks School_A 3rd and Student_D ranks School_A 2nd; both are plausible future applicants depending on rejections elsewhere. To maximize our outcome, we should reject Student_A now and keep the seat open for higher-priority candidates.
